data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Always great. Best omelette, fried chicken the best. They have the best chicken fried steak also. Good pancakes

data.title: Home cooking
data.text: This is one of those yummy hole in the wall locations. The food is really good, its a homey atmosphere and the prices are not bad.

data.title: Home style cooking
data.text: Very casual and a fun place to go with friends. A landmark in old downtown Frisco and great food. The fried catfish is about the best around

data.title: good place but  there are always day laobores outside and too many times  were cursing  scary stoped going
data.text: used to be a nice place to meet w friends but have stopped as outside the migrant day laoborers cursing, making comments about the women. I call it oitering but it seems to be gettinw rse now we avoide it for fear of crimes

data.title: Unique atmosphere, good food
data.text: You order at the counter where you walk in and then the order is brought to your table. The atmosphere is like an old style train depot, hence the name. The food is homey and well prepared. The menu is a little sparse, but what I had was well prepared and tasty.

data.title: Don't drive by
data.text: You could miss the Depot if your not careful but don't do it. Breakfast is outstanding. Service is great, clean place with friendly people. Love it.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good breakfast ,  good catfish, love the fried vhicken, always good food with good sides. Nice friendly  service. Will continue  going there .  Great

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Was in Frisco for business and stopped in for lunch. Got there about 11:45. Ordered the plate lunch special which was chicken spaghetti, corn, salad, and roll. Food was hot and fresh and super good. Shortly after noon the place got pretty busy, so come a lil early.

data.title: GREAT FIND
data.text: This is a wonderful local restaurant!  I had a baby spinach salad, with grilled chicken and an herb dressing.  I was on of the best salads that I have ever had.  The building is the old train depot and the people are very friendly.  I look forward to going back there.

data.title: great diner value
data.text: Down home diner style where all the locals migrate to. Breakfast & Lunch is just like grandma would serve. Limited dinner hours but Friday can be usually made. Burgers, chicken fried steak or chicken, pot roast; they do it all very-very well. Breakfast is just as good!

data.title: Brunch after Church
data.text: Since we moved to Frisco a few months ago, we've wanted to try the Depot Cafe. It seems to always get rave reviews. We decided this was the day. Following church Sunday morning, we ventured over to the cafe. We had a bit of a wait to order and get a table. You order before being seating. Both of us were pleased with our orders. Pancakes were exceptional. Ham and sausage patties were perfect. The Depot serves Community coffee, which always pleased my wife.

data.title: Food is mediocre at best.
data.text: We have eaten there, mainly on Sunday lunch time. If eating with other than couples, the food may be delivered at different times. Very noisy if the restaurant is busy. Seems to liked by many locals for its home cooking but they don't do a very good job of that.

data.title: Love The Depot
data.text: The Pot Roast on the special with two sides and a huge slice of cake is really good! Very friendly service. The decor inside is cute and not what you would expect when it's attached to a gas station.

data.title: Anybody Can Open Cans
data.text: Their website says it "...captures the essence of old-time Frisco with today's favorite comfort food." Well, the decor is cute but the food is awful. If their idea of "comfort food" is to open cans, then count me out. We each had the grilled pork chop plate with sides. The pork chop was so thin it almost had only one side - dry and tasteless - and blackeyed peas were straight out of an Allen's (brand) can with no seasoning added (and barely warm). My husband's green beans were the same canned and tasteless offering, as was the corn. The only thing worth eating was the fried okra, but I can get that at Norma's Cafe with all yummy food. Don't bother...

data.title: Frisco Landmark Restaurant
data.text: The Depot has been a landmark of old Frisco for a long time. The facility is well maintained and reflects the rich history of Frisco railroad history. We stopped by for lunch and had fried pork chops, green beans, blacked eyed peas, corn and fried okra. The pork chops were okay but the vegetables were probably right out of the can. We probably added the only seasoning at the table. The staff is friendly and helpful but The Depot is hard pressed to compete with Norma's, just two miles down the road.

data.title: Breakfast is fantastic!
data.text:
This is inside a building that is a gas station (the gas station part is connected on the north end).  I was a bit skeptical when my friend said they had good food, but I love to try new places so off on an adventure we went!  And breakfast was fantastic.  I had the Depot Breakfast which allows you to choose how you want your eggs cooked and how many, what meat, what side, etc.  I had the eggs over medium with bacon, shredded hash browns, wheat toast and as side of pancakes.  It's just like eating in Grandma's kitchen. Cooked to perfection and it tastes homemade.  We'll definitely be returning!  The bacon was cooked exactly how I like it - crispy but not burned.

You order the counter and they give you a number and then they'll bring out your food.  Similar to Corner Bakery in service style.

data.title: Underrated!
data.text: Breakfast at The Depot is terrific, with large portions and friendly service.  It's a staple of Frisco!

data.title: Such a friendly place!
data.text: A group of friends and I have been going to the Depot once a week for the past 15 years.They know us by name. Great home cooking and great family atmosphere.

data.title: Love going to The Depot!
data.text: I'm almost afraid to review this restaurant as it's one of our favorites and I don't want to have to wait in line!  The Depot is a Frisco landmark.  Great country breakfasts and yummy diner style lunches.  Its where you'll find the "old-timers" telling tall tales of early Frisco over steaming cups of coffee and homemade pie. But they don't serve dinner so get there early.

data.title: Best kept secret in Frisco!!!
data.text: I've been coming here for years and my recent visit reminded me why... This place has good food, it's clean, and you are always greeted with a smile and a kind word!!!  Make sure to check out the daily specials... Pot roast, meat loaf, chicken spaghetti... They are ALL good... It's located to the side of a gas station but when you step inside you know you are in for something good. Check out what the locals have known for years!!
